227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:19): 57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450: have you ever used SVG fonts?
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:21): I will freely admit that
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:21): yeah, there you go
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:21): I'm not a font designer
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:21): nor do I try to do anything funky with web pages
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:22): if those are the only use cases you've heard of, then you clearly haven't done the research or even thought very hard about it
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:22): then maybe you aren't the target audience, hm?
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:22): I  intend to mean the use cases that are not served by other font technologies
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:23): I don't suppose you could be more enlightening?
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:23): yes, there are other use cases that SVG fonts serve that aren't solved by other font formats
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:23): multicolored text is useful, even if you want to be dismissive of it
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:24): having fills that are not simple colors (or gradients) is another

227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:25): having overlapping lines, as has been done with hand-drawn and printed glyphs for thousands of years, and is used extensively in print advertising and art, but can't be done with other font formats, is another
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:26): being able to customize a font, or draw one from scratch, is another
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:26): embedding specific glyphs inside a single document (no external references) is another
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:26): it is possible to handle multicolored text with existing technology (i.e., heavy use of <span>)
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:27): embedding without external references seems like a poor design goal to me
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:27): that duplicates the text, and isn't very accessible or maintainable
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:27): color isn't accessible
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:27): animated glyphs can also be useful
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:28): 57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450: wtf does that mean?
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:28): if I'm blind, I can't see color
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:28): first off, accessibility doesn't mean "blind"‚Ä¶ there are lots of different kinds of disabilities
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:29): I'm trying to figure out how manually coloring each glyph would be less accessible than a font which automatically colored some of the glyphs
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:29): second, duplicating text to get multicolored glyphs for sighted users means that screen readers will double up the text
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:29): <span> isn't duplicating text
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:29): which is why your response is confusing to me
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:30): you'll have to be more explicit in how <span>s make a single glyph multicolored
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:30): withut duping it
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:31): I am personally not aware of cases that cause multicoloring of single glyphs

227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:31): and if you're just talking about changing the colors of individual glyphs in a word, you've just killed search, find, screenreading and all other uses of having a word
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:32): 57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450: then I suggest you look at print advertising, where it's used all the time
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:32): no, a<span>b</span>c is matched when I search for 'abc'
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:32): [I just tested it]
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:33): in a screenreader?
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:33): in a search engine?
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:33): not good enough
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:33): I am also dismissive that print advertising should be written in HTML
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:34): make some real, comprehensive test cases, and test them, and show some proof, then I'll credit your research
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:34): for that use case, I would support SVG fonts, but I do not think that warrants them as a necessity for support in a web browser
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:34): yeah, I'd say you're pretty dismissive, I agree
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:34): you are you to say what HTML should be used for?
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:34): the primary case people are talking about is web browsers
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:35): and whether or not SVG fonts should be a feature implemented by web browsers
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:35): you think designers don't want to build on the tradition of print media in browsers?
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:36): (and not just print, but TVs, giant screens, etc?)
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:37): why should it be necessary that you send the exact same content for a TV and a large poster advertisement that you do to my desktop computer?
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:37): why do you think HTML, SVG, and CSS are just on desktop computers? this isn't the 90s
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:38): I do not think that
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:38): let me rephrase it slightly
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:38): should my web browser support the same APIs as, say, a Tivo?
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (06:39): I am arguing that the domain for which svg fonts is suitable is not the same domain for which a web browser is intended to be used
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:40): and I would need to see much more evidence that that is true, because all the evidence I've seen is that the convergence of TV and the Web is already here
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:40): TV is now a service, as much as a device
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:41): one of my TV providers, Netflix, uses a Web browser on my PS3
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:41): it's written in HTML
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:42): (at least on some devices, if not on PS3, I'll have to check that)
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:43): HTML, CSS, JS, SVG, APIs, etc are now a primary programming platform, not just a "Web browser" ghetto
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:44): I'm surprised I have to make that point
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:45): font designers have approached the SVG WG about improving SVG fonts because the existing font formats don't meet the use cases they have
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:45): they know their business, and what they (and their clients) want to do
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:46): maybe we should listen to them?
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (06:46): anyway, I'm off to bed
